[金剛力士](https://arnulfo.wordpress.com/2013/06/22/%e9%87%91%e5%89%9b%e5%8a%9b%e5%a3%ab/)
Kongōrikishi (金剛力士) or Niō (仁王) are two wrath-filled and muscular guardians of the Buddha, standing today at the entrance of many Buddhist temples all across Asia including China, Japan and Korea in the form of frightening wrestler-like statues. They are manifestations of the BodhisattvaVajrapāṇi protector deity and the oldest and most …
